title: Conor McGregor backs Khabib Nurmagomedov to beat Tony Ferguson
text:
The UFC have cancelled Nurmagomedov vs Ferguson four times (Picture: Getty)

Conor McGregor is confident Khabib Nurmagomedov will be able to beat Tony Ferguson if they clash in his next title defence.

The lightweight champion has anointed Ferguson as his next challenger, a fight that the UFC have been forced to cancel on four separate occasions.

Nurmagomedov is expected to return to the octagon early next year and McGregor broke down why the Russian is the favourite to end Ferguson’s 12-fight winning streak.

‘It’ll be an interesting one, I think Khabib would probably beat him,’ McGregor said at an event in Russia.

McGregor has not fought for just over a year (Picture: Getty)

‘Again, you’ve got to see what the circumstances are. Anyone can win on any given day.

‘Tony is a formidable fighter. Also, he’s very, very, tough.

‘He does go down. He does get dropped. His guard has been passed.

‘He’s been mounted by a lesser fighter. So I would favour Khabib in that bout.’

While McGregor might think Nurmagomedov has the upper hand over Ferguson, the Irishman has made it clear he wants another crack the champion.

Speaking at the Parimatch event, McGregor insisted he would get ‘revenge and retribution’ over Nurmagomedov.

Nurmagomedov insists he will fight Ferguson next (Picture: Getty)

The 31-year-old has not fought since his loss to Nurmagomedov a year ago and has been dealing with a host of issues outside the octagon since then.

McGregor is set to meet the media again in Moscow on Thursday, where he could make an announcement about his next fight.

It is very unlikely McGregor will fight before the end of the year and Nurmagomedov has already insisted he will not grant him a rematch in the near future.
